page.title: 14MOVING TO THE SEISDON AREA?
page.content: With the difficulties attendant upon new building there is little opportunity for people wishing to move into this area except in the village of Seisdon itself. Many of the farm cottages are "tied", which means that they are not generally available and can be occupied only in connection with the tenant's employment. Other cottages are occupied by local people who have lived in the area all their lives and who are likely to remain there. These houses come on the market usually only on the death or changed circumstances of the occupant. Some houses have been bought and modernised by townspeople who wish to live in the country and commute to the town for work. However, this is not an area of weekend cottages and most houses, once acquired are occupied on a permanent basis.
